material.mattext: Which best describes a foreign key (FK)?
A unique identifier within its own table
A field referencing a primary key in another table
A free-text attribute with no constraints
A many-to-many relationship is typically modeled using:
A junction table with two FKs
NULL is closest in meaning to:
Choose the strongest primary key for People:
Each parent row matches zero or many child rows
Each child row matches zero or many parent rows
Each parent matches at most one child
Which constraint prevents duplicate values in a column?
A composite primary key is appropriate when:
A single column can uniquely identify rows
Uniqueness requires a combination of columns
Surrogate keys are preferred when natural keys:
Choose the best FK from Orders to Customers:
Which is true about JSON in analytics pipelines?
Which field is most likely categorical?
To model many-to-many between Orders and Promotions you should:
Add promo_code column in Orders only
Store JSON array in Orders and hope
A predicate on the right table in a LEFT JOIN should often live in:
SELECT region, SUM(sales) FROM t GROUP BY region
SELECT region, SUM(sales) FROM t GROUP BY sales
Identify the result of COUNT(*) on a LEFT join with unmatched rows:
Which orders query lists top 10 customers by revenue?
ORDER BY SUM(total) DESC LIMIT 10 with GROUP BY customer_id
Which window function previews appear later?
Safest join key between orders and customers:
To exclude cancelled orders after aggregation, prefer:
SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM t) as x
Which count gets unique customers per region?
Which is valid comment in SQL (SQLite/Postgres)?
Best tool to summarize Sales by Region by Month quickly:
COUNT of unique IDs in a pivot often needs:
Which lookup is robust and non-volatile?
To refresh a pivot after data change:
Your pivot double counts revenue. Likely cause:
Which chart works well with monthly sales:
A volatile function to avoid in large models:
In Excel Data Model, multiple tables relate via:
Best design when subgroups must be represented proportionally:
Cluster sampling typically trades precision for:
All possible values of a variable
When sampling cost per unit varies by stratum, efficient allocation uses:
A biased frame most likely causes:
Which sampling plan fits 5 regions with travel constraints?
Minimal ICPSR-style metadata should also include:
Decreases vs SRS for equal n
Increases vs SRS for equal n
